sense.name: focus attention on, keep tabs on
sense.examples: Observe the pose of the figures in the foreground of this painting. We couldn't observe the eclipse because of the overcast skies. No one observed the crime being committed. The chorus didn't appear to observe the conductor's tempo and got ahead of him. Wall Street has been observing the process of this merger with some interest. I observed a woman meowing into her cell phone yesterday.

sense.name: adhere to or engage in a practice
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1 OBSERVE NP2[patient] Note: often respectful actions towards a tradition
sense.examples: When did the country start observing Martin Luther King day? John's family observes the Sabbath. They are claiming that they intend to observe the conditions of the contract. The team observed a moment of silence in Ms. Weber's memory.

sense.name: discover or detect
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1 OBSERVE[punctual] NP NP1 OBSERVE[punctual] SCOMP
sense.examples: I observed a definite change in Jane's behavior at work last week. Scientists have observed a sharp drop in vulture populations in India recently. Analysts have observed that China's energy demands have grown in recent years.

sense.name: remark or mention, state
sense.examples: "Mary is always late for dinner," observed John, glancing at his watch. She observed to the other session members that they should disable their cellphones.
